description.narrative: Consolidating Peace and Prosperity and Social Cohesion in Solomon Islands Post RAMSI

activity-description.narrative: Ministry of National Unity, Reconciliation and Peace

description.narrative:
1. % of communities (men and women) who feel that peace will be maintained provinces 2. change of perception, % of perception in communities satisfied with SIG efforts to address development challenges in provinces 3. change of perception, % of perception in provinces that efforts are made to address decentralization and provincial aspirations
Output Indicator 1.1.1 - Progress through follow up actions taken by the government for ensuring an inclusive process for ensuring communique follow up Output Indicator 1.1.2 - Progress towards the formulation of a national reparation policy and bill Output Indicator 1.3.1 - Progress towards the implementation of recommendations of the government’s report on customary land reform

comment.narrative: Perception Survey National Peace Policy TBD

Outcome Indicator 01: • Establishment of National Peacebuilding Advisory Committee (NPAC) • Hold two meetings of NPAC Output Indicator 1.1.1: • Establishment of 3 Women Caucus in 3 of Provinces Output Indicator 1.2.1 • Preparatory Sessions for women leaders on reparation consultation • Hold consultations with Stakeholders for national reparation policy and bill. • Establishment of Reparation working group committee with meetings • Hold scoping consultations on reparation work • Development of draft reparation policy • Hold consultation on draft reparation policy Output Indicator 1.3.1 • Preparatory Session for women and youth on land issues • Hold land summits • Land tribunal innovation workshop Output Indicator 1.4.1 • Anti-Corruption workshop for youths (especially females) to advocate good governance & anti-corruption • Hold workshop for journalists Output Indicator 1.5.1 • Finalization endorsement & launch of the gender policies of three provinces including: Malaita, Guadalcanal & western province • Hold mock sessions with community women leaders to better articulate the gender & women issues in the policy dialogues • Hold Policy dialogues with the leaders to introduce the gender policies Output Indicator 1.5.2 • Outreach initiative targeting youth and women in the remote communities in partnership with MNURP and MWCFA on peacebuilding & political participation Output indicator 2.1.2 • Introduction sessions for youths on social entrepreneurship & social innovation. • Hold bootcamp training for youths for social innovation • Establishment of youth peacebuilding innovation forum Output indicator 2.2.1 • Launch of National Youth Policy Output indicator 2.3.1 • Hold meeting with border working group in Choiseul Taro

Outcome Indicator 01: • Established National Peacebuilding Advisory Committee (NPAC) • Held two meetings of NPAC. The meeting was attended by 24 participants (18 Male & 06 female) Output Indicator 1.1.1: • 3 Women Caucus established in 3 of Provinces (Guadalcanal, Malaita and Western Province) Output Indicator 1.2.1 • 55 women community leaders participated in 3 preparatory sessions for women leaders on reparation consultation were held in Guadalcanal, Malaita and Choiseul/western • 06 Consultations held with Stakeholders for national reparation policy and bill • Reparation working group committee established and 6 meetings were held • 3 scoping consultations held in Guadalcanal, Malaita and Western & Choiseul • Draft reparation policy developed • 3 consultations held on draft reparation policy in western province, Malaita & Guadalcanal Output Indicator 1.3.1 • 1 Preparatory session held in Malaita for women and youth on land issues • 2 land summits were held in Guadalcanal and Malaita • land tribunal innovation workshop was organized for ministry of land & survey and office of the PM Output Indicator 1.4.1 • Two Anti-Corruption workshops held for youths (especially females) of Honiara & Guadalcanal to advocate good governance & anti-corruption • 2 workshops were arranged for the journalists to enhance understanding on good governance and anti-corruption Output Indicator 1.5.1 • Gender policies of three provinces including: Malaita, Guadalcanal & western province were endorsement & launched • 4 mock sessions were held with community women leaders of three provinces (Malaita, Guadalcanal & western) to better articulate the gender & women issues in the policy dialogues • 4 policy dialogues (2 national & 2 provincial) were held with the leaders to introduce the gender policies Output Indicator 1.5.2 • Undertaken radio program targeting youth and women in the remote communities in partnership with MNURP and MWCFA on peacebuilding & political participation Output indicator 2.1.2 • Introduction sessions for youths on social entrepreneurship & social innovation. • Hold bootcamp training for youths for social innovation • Establishment of youth peacebuilding innovation forum Output indicator 2.2.1 • 1 national event held to launch of National Youth Policy Output indicator 2.3.1 • 1 meeting held with border working group in Choiseul Taro

Output 1.1 (Activity Result 1.1.1):
* Facilitate National Peacebuilding Advisory Committee (NPAC) to hold quarterly meetings
Output 1.1 (Activity Result 1.1.2):
* Capacity building for Provincial Women’s Caucus (PWCs)
* Support PWC to hold regular meetings
* Support PWC’s Meeting with Executive
* Support at least one activity of PWC
* Lessons learned workshop for PWC for 3 provinces
* Monitoring visits to the 3 hotspot provinces
* Youth Caucus launching and Induction for Malaita, Guadalcanal and Western Provinces
* Capacity Building workshops (leadership, communications/presentation skills, Govt protocols etc)
Output 1.1 (Activity Result 1.1.3):
* Commission targeted research & surveys
Output 1.2 (Activity Result 1.2.1):
* Finalization TRC/Reparation
* Consultations/multi sectoral on way forward for TRC/Reparation
Output 1.2 (Activity Result 1.2.2):
* Conduct training need assessment in weather cost
* Support MNURP reconciliation (peacebuilding, no compensation) work in hotspot communities
* Peace building and Mediation skill trainings for women and community leaders
Output 1.3 (Activity Result 1.3.1):
* Mapping and research on land issues
* Support to MNURP + Ministry of Land on to facilitate and resolve land disputes some national project (Tandai project)
Output 1.3 (Activity Result 1.3.3):
* Support the Work with the Land recording unit – Visale project site
Output 1.4 (Activity Result 1.4.1):
* Training to journalist and gov leaders on anti-corruption and integrity
Output 1.4 (Activity Result 1.4.2):
* Facilitate engagement between CSO and policy makers on integrity and anti-corruption
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.1):
* Support WPS National Taskforce to develop advocacy material/tools on WPS
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.2):
* Training on WPS and integrating WPS agenda in various ministries and gov programming
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.3):
* Support on TSM advocacy and campaign to partners in Western Province/Guadalcanal/Malaita provinces
* Support to MWYCFA and woman organizations to work on TSM issues in the three provinces
* WPP Advocacy tools/materials

Output 1.1 (Activity Result 1.1.1): • Two NPAC meetings were held in March 21, 2019 and June 24, 2019. Total 39 participants (F=12, M=27) attended these meeting.
Output 1.1 (Activity Result 1.1.2): • Capacity Building training held for Provincial Women's Caucus (PWCs) of Guadalcanal, Malaita and Western Province. 27 participants (F=26, M=01), including government officials, attended the training. • Two Provincial Youth Caucus orientation sessions were held in Malaita and Western Province. 21 participants (F=10, M=11) attended the orientation session. • Two Provincial Youth Caucus capacity building training sessions were held in Malaita and Western Province. 27 participants (F=14, M=13), including provincial government officials, attended the orientation session.
Output 1.2 (Activity Result 1.2.1): • Consultative workshops with different stakeholders were held for DDR policy and reparations. A total 337 stakeholders/participants (F=215, M=122) attended the workshops. • Launching of the boundary walk conducted for Kakau and Simbo tribal land boundary. 87 participants (F=30, M=57) attended the boundary walk.
Output 1.2 (Activity Result 1.2.2): • Gender needs assessment conducted in Weather Coast (Marau). A total 36 community members and stakeholders (F=20, M=16) were consulted through FGDs and interviews. • Four 5-days ToTs were held for the community leaders (female & males) of target provinces/locations of the project including; Honiara, Guadalcanal, Malita, Choiseul, Western province. PBF project (phase-II) was successful to establish cohort of a total 92 trained community leaders (F=38, M=54) as master trainers.
Output 1.4 (Activity Result 1.4.1): • One Anti-Corruption Awareness for Guadalcanal Provincial Youths and Women was held. 50 participants (F=21, M=29) attended the awareness session.
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.1): • Two Provincial WPS Gender Mainstreaming Awareness and Advocacy Workshops were conducted. The workshops were attended by 59 participants (F=27, M=32).
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.2): • NPAC members and National Taskforce for WPS were sensitized through an awareness session on WPS and integrating WPS agenda in various ministries and gov programming. The session was attended by 14 participants (F=6, M=8).
Output 1.5 (Activity Result 1.5.3): • Three TSM advocacy and awareness sessions were conducted for the partners/stakeholders in Western Province/Guadalcanal/Malaita provinces. These awareness sessions were attended by 50 participants (F=32, M=18). • Gender sensitive outreach campaign held to increase awareness among the voters, especially women voters on the importance of both voting and voting for fair representation. A total 425,213 community members (not individuals) were outreached out through different mediums including; SMS, Newspaper and Social Media Platforms (Facebook, Twitter etc.).
Output 2.1 (Activity Result 2.1.2): • 12 youth winners from Gizo & Munda from Western province were capacitated through business and financial literacy training.
